Posts.Content: May 14, 2009 11:39AM bunny5367 wrote: I was diagnosed in October 2007 - Stage 1 invasive- my tumor was ER/PR + plus HER/2 was 3+ overexpressed.  I had a lumpectomy with 4 lymphnodes removed - the cancer didn't spread anywhere else - all nodes were clear - I then went through 6 rounds of chemo - 1x every 3 weeks and Herceptin 1x every 3 weeks for a whole year.  My oncologists used TCH treatment.  It was a long year, but had my least Herceptin treatment in December 2008.  I also had 30 rounds of radiation after my chemo last May and June.  I had my first 3 month check up in March and an MRI done back in December and I am all clear - bye bye cancer!  I don't have to see my oncologist now until September - once every 6 months now!  I am taking Tomaxafin for 5 years but I feel healthier now than ever before and my doctors say that with all this treatment there is maybe a 5% chance of it coming back after 5 years!  I am training right now for my first triathlon on June 28th at Lake Lanier in Georgia!  Life is wonderful and your mom will be just fine!
Posts.Title: For my Mom aka Superwoman Nicole_Bronx Nicole_Bronx
